attributes.action: Encourage shared parenting through recognition of two parents with care
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
More and more families have divorced Mums and Dads. The current legislation automatically assumes that the main parent is the mother (in most cases).

This means "good" Dads who takes an equal involvement in their child’s upbringing are still asked to pay maintenance to the mother, even if they earn less than the mother.

The CSA reduce payments (of 15%) by 1/7 for each day the Dad cares, this means only a 50% reduction for 100% shared care! A dad who looks after his child for 4 days out of 7 still pays the Mum!

This is a petition for this mathematical error to be corrected! Shared care should equal zero %. 

Rather than the current stepped reduction of

15% 0 day
12.9% 1 day
10.7% 2 days
8.6% 3 days
7.5% 3.5 days (shared care)

We would propose to use a start point of 17.5% with 5% steps per day.

17.5% 0 day
12.5% 1 day
7.5% 2 days
2.5% 3 days
0% 3.5 days (shared care)

This would encourage fathers to take responsibility for their child’s upbringing rather than discouraging it as the current system does.
